biostoreCapacity 0.0.0.9000

Forecast capacity using a brms growth curve (no regular spacing; posterior propagation)

single_brms_growth.Rd

Fits two simple brms models to forecast the covariates on the original (irregular) date grid, then fits a logistic growth curve for total capacity where the inflection time (xmid) is shifted by the covariates. It produces daily forecasts for a given horizon and reports the first dates when the posterior mean and the 95% upper credible bound reach capacity = 1.

Usage

single_brms_growth(horizon = 12, chains = 2, iter = 2000, seed = 123)

Arguments

horizon

Integer; number of months to forecast ahead.

chains, iter, seed

MCMC settings passed to brms::brm().

Value

A list with fitted models, a forecast data.frame, crossing dates, and a ggplot object.

Details

Key points:

  • No regularization of historical dates (we keep your original spacing).

  • Same covariates as ARIMA: prop_1ml, total_submitted_capacity.

  • Posterior propagation: we forward posterior draws from the covariate models into the growth model instead of using point forecasts.

Examples

# res <- single_brms_growth()
# res$mean_cross_date; res$upper_cross_date; res$plot
